sgw_utils.features package¶

Submodules¶

sgw_utils.features.dsift_extractor module¶

sgw_utils.features.dsift_extractor.denseSIFT(img, steps)[source]¶

Output SIFT descriptors on dense keypoints lined up in a grid.

Parameters:
  • img – Source image.
  • step – Dense steps of keypoints.
Returns:

Keypoints and SIFT descriptors on them.

sgw_utils.features.fisher module¶

sgw_utils.features.fisher.dictionary(descriptors, N)[source]¶
sgw_utils.features.fisher.fisher_features(input_folder, working_folder, gmm, dense_steps=30, extension='jpg', file='fisher_features.npy')[source]¶

Calcluate fisher features on images with GMM parameters estimated in advance.

Parameters:
  • input_folder – Path to folder containing images.
  • working_folder – Path to folder where the model parameters are saved in.
  • gmm – GMM model as a parameter tuple of (means, covariances, mixture weights).
  • dense_steps – Dense steps of keypoints to be used for SIFT feature extraction.
  • extension – Suffix of images.
  • file – Filename of features. This is used when saving.
Returns:

Calculated fisher features as numpy array in shape of (classes_num, smaples_num, dimensionality).
sgw_utils.features.fisher.fisher_vector(samples, means, covs, w)[source]¶
sgw_utils.features.fisher.fisher_vector_means(s0, s1, s2, means, sigma, w, T)[source]¶
sgw_utils.features.fisher.fisher_vector_sigma(s0, s1, s2, means, sigma, w, T)[source]¶
sgw_utils.features.fisher.fisher_vector_weights(s0, s1, s2, means, covs, w, T)[source]¶
sgw_utils.features.fisher.folder_descriptors(folder, dense_steps=30, extension='jpg')[source]¶
sgw_utils.features.fisher.folder_descriptors_original(folder)[source]¶
sgw_utils.features.fisher.generate_gmm(input_folder, working_folder, N=5, dense_steps=30, extension='jpg')[source]¶

Fit a GMM(Gaussian mixture model) from dense SIFT descriptors and save its parameters.

Parameters:
  • input_folder – Path to folder containing images.
  • working_folder – Path to folder where the model parameters are saved in.
  • N – Mixed number of the model.
  • dense_steps – Dense steps of keypoints to be used for SIFT feature extraction.
  • extension – Suffix of images.
Returns:

GMM parameters which are means, covariances, and mixture weights.

sgw_utils.features.gabor module¶

sgw_utils.features.gabor.calc_texture_energy(array, w_size=5)[source]¶
sgw_utils.features.gabor.gabor_descriptor(args)[source]¶
sgw_utils.features.gabor.gabor_features(input_folder, working_folder, extension='jpg', file='gabor_features.npy', max_threads=1)[source]¶

Calcluate Gabor features on images.

Parameters:
  • input_folder – Path to folder over sub directories containing images.
  • working_folder – Path to folder where the model parameters are saved in.
  • extension – Suffix of images.
  • file – Filename of features. This is used when saving.
  • max_threads – Max threads for multiprocessing.
Returns:

Calculated fisher features as numpy array in shape of (classes_num, smaples_num, dimensionality).
sgw_utils.features.gabor.gabor_features_in_patchscale(input_floder, working_folder, patch_size=32, extension='jpg', file='gabor_features_for_evaluations.npy', max_threads=1)[source]¶

Calcluate Gabor features on patches cropped from images along scan line.

Parameters:
  • input_folder – Path to folder over sub directories containing images.
  • working_folder – Path to folder where the model parameters are saved in.
  • patch_size – Size of patch width and height, which is used for cropping patches from images.
  • extension – Suffix of images.
  • file – Filename of features. This is used when saving.
  • max_threads – Max threads for multiprocessing.
Returns:

Calculated fisher features as numpy array in shape of (classes_num, smaples_num, dimensionality).
